intro: Tounatea bracteosa, commonly known as the bracteosa tree, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and other economically important trees. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, fragrant flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. It produces woody fruits that contain flat, winged seeds, aiding in wind dispersal. Tounatea bracteosa is valued for its timber and has traditional uses in local medicine.
